name: Fruit Spirit
description: Fruit Spirit is a 60% sativa-dominant hybrid that was bred by Royal Queen Seeds through crossing Blueberry and White Widow. This is a match made in heaven, as Fruit Spirit inherits a pleasant blueberry aroma and White Widow’s heavy resin production. A sense of happiness eases the mind in total cerebral relaxation, making Fruit Spirit suitable for patients treating mood disorders, anxiety, or depression. This sweet-smelling hybrid flowers in 7 to 8 weeks indoors, but outdoor gardens should only be grown in warm, sunny regions.
descriptionPlain: Fruit Spirit is a 60% sativa-dominant hybrid that was bred by Royal Queen Seeds through crossing Blueberry and White Widow. This is a match made in heaven, as Fruit Spirit inherits a pleasant blueberry aroma and White Widow’s heavy resin production. A sense of happiness eases the mind in total cerebral relaxation, making Fruit Spirit suitable for patients treating mood disorders, anxiety, or depression. This sweet-smelling hybrid flowers in 7 to 8 weeks indoors, but outdoor gardens should only be grown in warm, sunny regions.

highlightedReviews.text: By far Fruit Spirit is the strain for those who have horrendous mood swings. It balanced me and made me meditate and take a nap it kind of reset me, even though it felt like a nap and meditation was actually listening to washed out and spaced out. It changed the way I valued life it was incredible and I can't describe that I felt the same, just that there was more in life and it changed me I can't get enough of this strain!

I was looking for something to smoke in the mornings that would help me get my day going and this joint of fruit pebbles did the trick. You can smell the fruity scent off the bud as soon as you open the bottle. Good for getting the day going and keeping it going.

articles.title: New Strains Alert: Cactus, Elderberry Kush, Fruit Spirit, Shiatsu Kush, and Y Griega
articles.author: Bailey Rahn
articles.text:
This week, we’ve got five news strains that come from all over the world: Spain, Canada — even Japan. From Spain we have Elderberry Kush, Fruit Spirit, and Y Griega. Shiatsu Kush was brought from Japan and bred in Canada, where our new indica Cactus also originally hails from. Some of these strains have migrated far and wide, so if any of these have made their way to your neck of the woods, tell us all about it in a review!
  1. Cactus
Characteristics of Cactus:

75% indica
Cross between Afghani and Northern Lights
Breeder: Jordan of the Islands (Canada)
Earthy, woody, citrus aromas
Brings euphoric, relaxed, and focused effects
Good for pain, spasms and anxiety
	 

 2. Elderberry Kush
Characteristics of Elderberry Kush:

55% indica
Cross between Edelweiss #3 and Dojaberry
Breeder: Green Devil Genetics (Spain)
Flowers in 50 to 55 days
	 

 3. Fruit Spirit
Characteristics of Fruit Spirit:

60% sativa
Cross between Blueberry and White Widow
Breeder: Royal Queen Seeds (Spain)
Blueberry aroma
Delivers happy and relaxed effects
Helps some patients with mood disorders, anxiety, and depression
Flowers in 7 to 8 weeks
	 

 4. Shiatsu Kush
Characteristics of Shiatsu Kush:

Hybrid strain
From Amami Oshima, Japan and propagated by BC Bud Depot (Canada)
Pine, vanilla, and cedar aromas
Relaxes the mind and body
Used to relieve pain, tension, and stress
Flowers in 50 to 56 days
	 

 5. Y Griega
Characteristics of Y Griega:

80% sativa
Cross between Amnesia and Kali Mist
Sweet floral, and citrus aromas
Delivers an energetic cerebral buzz followed by a long-lasting calm
May help patients treat pain, inflammation, glaucoma, fatigue, and appetite loss
Flowers in 85 to 95 days
